website_summaries.verdict: High-quality router offered at a great price point that supports all of the latest wireless networking technologies.
pros: Includes secure remote access, so you can use your router safely in your home
Has a dual band design and offers an impressive maximum 1,733 Mbps transmission speed on the 5GHz band
Allows you to use beamforming to direct the signal at the devices that need the maximum data speed
cons: Some models may not last as long as you’d expect

customer_reviews.title: Again, Amazon "Answers" ROCK!!!
customer_reviews.text: My previous WiFi router - a Linksys - got fried after a power outage & quit working. Multiple resets didn't work, either. The first 2 new routers I tried use "Mesh" technology, which means that in order to configure them, you have to use a smartphone running Android 8.0 or above, which mine doesn't. Before I bought this one, I asked on Amazon Q&A if you could use a PC (Web browser) to configure this one for security, and 2 people said "YES". That was good enough for me! Thanks again, Amazon Answers!
customer_reviews.author: Chris JungTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: It is not stable and it will not last long at all very cheaply made!
customer_reviews.text: Two weeks out of the box disconnects all devices says it’s online but no device can connect to 2.4 or 5. Have to reset the stupid thing. And it’s happened twice brand new ac2600 archer 10 garbage. Don’t get me wrong my asus 66u would drop every once an a while. But it didn’t do it 2 weeks out of the box! I will never buy TP Link again! Don’t buy tp link they don’t hold up! UPDATE: Netgear trash just as bad I guess asus is our only hope unfortunately!
customer_reviews.author: GrowingFamily18

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable or stable at all
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a four year old TP-Link Archer C7 that really had trouble connecting a large number of clients. With more than 30 connected devices at all times that can easily top 50 when guests are in the house I needed a MIMO capable system. This unit worked great for about three months before it started randomly dropping groups of devices. After rebooting everything numerous times I still can't get every device connected. They can see the router but simply can't connect. Take a pass on this router. I'm past the return window on mine but I will try to get TP-Link to at least exchange it under warranty. It's terrible.
customer_reviews.author: texmln

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a couple months, now I can't get 2.4 G to connect
customer_reviews.text: I thought I could be the lucky one to not get the same issue as others have reported, but it happened. I've been enjoying great and speedy internet for the past 3 months. Then after restarting the system once I can't get the 2.4 GHz to connect. It will work for an hour, then completely disappear. The 5 GHz works fine, but the other doesn't and if you use smart devices, like Alexa or smart switches they rely on 2.4 GHz. I've factory reset the system, shows up then disappears, reset power, same thing. I've looked it up and this has been an issue for several customers. Real hassle and would buy their product again.
customer_reviews.author: Kambria E.

customer_reviews.title: Wifi signal died after two months, poor customer support
customer_reviews.text: Started out great, and was a big improvement on the router provided by my internet provider (Frontier). However, two months down the road, and wifi speeds and signal have dropped dramatically. I got in touch with TP-Link's customer support, and spent over an hour on chat waiting for their replies every 8 minutes. Suggestion? Factory reset, well I did that and, unsurprisingly, it didn't fix it. Now I'm having to communicate by email with someone in the far east. Just replace the defective unit - it's only two months old. I cannot recommend this product, nor the customer support.
customer_reviews.author: Buz

customer_reviews.title: Don't mistake this for a LINKSYS
customer_reviews.text: I accidentally bought this TP-LINK 2600 because I mistook it for a LINKSYS EA7300 that I bought earlier this year. Let's compare. Price? The same. Features? The same - the MIMO was what I was wanted, powerful beamforming to crush my neighbors' interference, see the bitrate driven before me and hear the latencies of the - never mind. Interface? Same deal, setup via a webpage or WPS. The Linksys took 5 minutes, TP-link more like 10. Uptime? I have to reset the TP-link multiple times a day, or the WiFi won't connect any client. Linksys? I installed it 6 months ago and have never had to touch it again. Don't buy this piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: neurotome

customer_reviews.title: Died at the 4 month mark
customer_reviews.text: This was a brilliant modem until yesterday. Without warning, it just started dropping the connection to the internet every 5 minutes. I would reboot, and it might go for 5 minutes or more, depending on what I was pushing through it. Last night, it made it all night. This morning, I tried to watch a YouTube stream for work, and it died. Pulled out my old Archer C7 and was up and running again in 15 minutes. $120 for 4 months of usage.
customer_reviews.author: leathej1

customer_reviews.title: Great Router for Price
customer_reviews.text: The router has performed great so far for my needs. I really enjoy the user interface and experience when using the app on my iPhone or online. It feels sleek, clean, and easy to use. So far, the connection has been good and it does seem to travel far. The only reason I left a star off of it is that the shiny plastic on top came scratched and scuffed and can't be removed. It is cosmetic at most, but I think the type of plastic used could be enhanced to make it look nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle N.

customer_reviews.title: Reliably quick WiFi signal and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: Increased WiFi speeds from my older NetGear router which was expected as it was 4+ years old. Now experiencing consistent connections across all devices. WiFi signal is strong throughout our 2 story house. Haven't had to reboot the router in the month or so that it has been installed and very happy with ease of setup. Spectrum ISP with 200Mbps package and I consistently get more than that via wireless on 5GHz band while also supporting 10+ smart plugs/devices.
customer_reviews.author: JKHfam

customer_reviews.title: random drops
customer_reviews.text: After having used this a few weeks, I've noticed a lot of random disconnects. It only lasts for a few seconds but is increasingly bothersome as 2 of us are working from home right now and need a reliable connection. After trying reboots, adjusting the channels and dns, I've resorted to reading the forums - where many people have the same issue. If I'm not able to find a resolution soon, I'll exchange it for another brand :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: False Advertising. Slow WiFi Speeds.
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly disappointed with the performance of this router. I purchased it after upgrading my internet to 1000 Mbps and finding that none of my wireless devices (all except one wired device) could achieve more than 250 Mbps down. I read that this router was rated at a 1.7 Gbps wireless download speed and was shocked to see it this was achieving slower speeds than my original issued router. If you are looking to improve your WiFi speeds, this is not the solution. I will exploring MoCA technology next.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Jones

customer_reviews.title: Wifi range
customer_reviews.text: Replacing older version of this model that did not last long. I decided to try this model and see how it performs. Very easy setup. Smaller in size than my old router. This one has 3 antennas where old had 4. I was having problems with internet, dropped a lot while streaming. Talked to my internet provider and we decided after several tests that router was bad. Only problem so far is range. I don't have good range like before. Will have to us a wifi extender. Will see and hope this router lasts longer.
customer_reviews.author: fatboy04

customer_reviews.title: Super High Power - Great Signal
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly my space is smaller than most but I live in a building with all units around me having pretty strong wifi signals so it was difficult to get around the overlapping signals no matter what channel you are on. This unit, even with the default selections performed at 10X the speed of my last Cisco router. My experience is that I am getting about 70% of the full cable modem speed. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: John K.

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link vs Netgear
customer_reviews.text: Product met and exceeds expectations. I was having a few issues with dropped WIFI connections and realized my NETGEAR AC1750 was the issue. Bought this router and haven't had an issue since. Bonus feature: My kids HATE the parental controls that can limit usage (which I love!). So if you want to hear kids screaming when their Fortnite suddenly cuts out at bedtime, BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.author: Kinzo

customer_reviews.title: Bottleneck....
customer_reviews.text: I have gig service and this router is a chock point on both lan and Wi-Fi. Best wired with cat6e 350/280mb. The best on both frequency was 180/171mb 1 time other tests dropped down to 120/118. These were the best results at 5 and 15 ft.
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: Needs daily rebooting
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for the first month, nice and fast— right up until the end of Amazon’s return window 2 weeks ago. It has tanked ever since. Drops the connection daily and has to be rebooted. I’ve been on the phone with technical service twice; no fix. And now it’s unreturnable. There goes $$$ down the drain. I’m going back to my ancient but dependable Apple router.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk. Connection drops every day.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a couple of months and now connection drops every day multiple times per day for both 5 and 2.5 GHz. I have to restart it multiple time a day for my devices to work. Hate it. And yes, it has updated firmware and such. Apparently all of the TP Link routers have this problem according to their forum. “Great” developers team. Stay away!
customer_reviews.author: Ksenia O Burova

customer_reviews.title: Could not be easier to install
customer_reviews.text: I pulled a failing wifi router and plugged in the AC2600 and opened a brower and went to the installation link. The app asked for the password to be used for the admin and for those using the router and then it completed the installation in a few minutes. That was it for the installation. Network was down for less than 3 minutes. The people at TP-Link have done an excellent job of making it as easy as possible for anyone to install this WiFi router on their home or office network.
customer_reviews.author: WinterTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great router, simple to setup with many advanced features
customer_reviews.text: I came to this router from a Netgear Nighthawk and couldn't be happier. It's really easy to setup. Signal strength is great and it's been rock solid. If you're a power user, the firmware has any feature you could want. Scheduled reboot, super easy port forwarding and integration with DDNS services. I can't believe it costs as little as it does.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great and corrected many problems.
customer_reviews.text: This TP-Link AC2600 Archer A10 router solved a lot of problems in our home and office. Speed is better than other models I've recently tried and IP addressing seems smarted, speeding up my local network tremendously. User interface is browser-based making the router easy to configure from any location. User interface is clear and easy to understand and permits more than enough settings for the average user, including multiple wireless options. I bought a few for maximizing coverage in a larger home and another older brick structure. If I could add anything, I'd offer an additional set of indicator lights on the front edge for those that have their routers high on shelves. Good work TP-Link!
customer_reviews.author: AreGee

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY if you have Nest Thermostat
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this product, which worked very well initially. However, after only about one month, the WIFI would would not work (always offline). I tried many experiments and realized it was the Nest Thermostats that cause the problem. As soon as I connect the router with the Nest thermostat, the wifi will drop (doesn't matter if it's the 2.4 or the 5 bandwidth). I tried everything I can think of, including updating firmwares, to no avail. Now the router is completely unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Explore.

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as expected
customer_reviews.text: Prior to switching to this modem i had ac1200 which had downloads speeds of 430 mbps Switched to this modem for upgrade Download speeds max out at 225 mbps So kinda dissapointed...but works ok
customer_reviews.author: Gearhead3000

customer_reviews.title: Outperformed my Nighthawk X10 (AD7200)
customer_reviews.text: Totally ecstatic with this compact TP-Link Archer A10 (AC2600) has consistently outperformed my NETGEAR Nighthawk X10 (AD7200). The same devices where able to connect at a much further distance, and the throughput (connection speed) was significantly faster. The A10's signal passed through walls, as well as through my upstairs floor, with no issues at all. I was surprised, considering the vast cost difference between the two. I had purchased both via Amazon, though the TP-Link A10 was only $120 (plus tax), while I shelled out $350 (plus tax) for the NETGEAR X10. I wished that I had never wasted my money on the NEATGEAR.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: 5G was non-existent
customer_reviews.text: Seems like an ok router, but the 5G band is almost non-existent. I probably connected to it 4 times before it just stopped working. I checked the firmware, which was fully updated, and tried all of "fixes" that techs have recommended online. Nothing worked. I got stuck on 3G. Forget that. Returned and replaced with an ASUS router that was easier to set up, had more features, and actually lets you use the 5G network. This was my first TP-Link product, and it will be my last.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Powerful.  Inexpensive.  Easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Okay you guys exceeded expectations with the router. Main reason was ease of setup. I resisted using the iPhone app at first but as soon as I did that the router basically set itself up. Amazing as mine is a non-standard setup as I already have a modem/router combo that has its own DHCP server. (Btw I did disable the WiFi in the ATT router so the only WiFi radios turned on are the ones inside the TP Link router) And the new setup reaches every corner of my house. Thanks for the nice product
customer_reviews.author: R. Darrow

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Have a ~ 3500 sq ft house and was going to buy a wifi booster to supplement my older Netgear router. Decided to try this first. Whereas previously signal strength waxed and waned through 4 walls into the den, this router provides a consistent signal. The speed one laptop went from 10 mb DN to 45 > 50 mb. Also, my wife's laptop was in the same room as the router and when she played an interactive game I would experience disconnects in the den - not any longer. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: mike mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Sadly, It didn't make it 24 hours!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to finally make the switch from my 7 year old Apple Extreme router that was super reliable, but falling behind with technology! The TP-Link router was super easy to setup. It worked great the first day, but sadly failed on the second day of use! It would drop the 5ghz signal regularly. Returned and went with a ASUS, and it has worked great so far!
customer_reviews.author: tmab

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router!
customer_reviews.text: Was having issues with my home WiFi and bought this router based on reviews, very pleased! My download speed went from 30 Mbps to 190 Mbps!!! Was paying for Comcast premium internet speed and not receiving it because of my old router. Super easy to install and setup. My entire house has excellent speed now. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chilli

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I had an old router that is about three years old. It worked OK for when I used it in the evenings after coming home from work. But since we started working from home, our consumption spiked and reliability is critical. Saw the good reviews and decided that we needed the upgrade. It's been about two weeks now, and the signal is always going strong. No dropped signal yet. Very satisfied with this performance. There is also an app that allows you to manage the router,see who is on, control access speeds, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Will Phan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: This router was up and running in five minutes, then I had to update all my computer login’s to the WIFI. No problems and the signal strength is much better than my previous 6-year old TP- Link router. The signal from this unit reaches outside the house and I was also able to remove the TP-Extender I bought 2-years ago. Downloads are faster and signals more reliable. Once again, TP-Link has improved my Internet reception. Tech support is left blank because I have not needed it in the last 5- years, however, previous support was always great too.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I think every wifi router I've looked at, even the best reviewed ones, have a few here and there that are just duds. I have not had any connection issues. Speeds have been great, the 5GHz channel allows me to connect and use the full 200mb/s internet connection I have. Connection speeds from even 50-60 yards outside my apartment are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: CedJR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing router with a amazing price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the Xfinity modem /router is garbage. I don't have a home computer so I used my phone to set this up it was super easy just download the app. I now have super fast 5ghz speeds all over my very large apartment. My wifi speeds litterly doubled with this router. We can now all use the wifi with no issue and that's streaming TV and playing video games. I highly recommend this if your having wifi coverage issues and speed issues. For how much this costs compared to much more expensive units I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Rozwadowski

customer_reviews.title: Nice Router for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Had an issue with Spectrum WIFI in a short term rental I own. WIFI was constantly dropping out which isn't a surprise since their gear is low grade. This isn't acceptable since I'm paying a monthly fee for this crap unit. I swapped it out for the TP router and issues disappeared. WIFI since has been rock solid. This is important since all TVs in this house are smart TVs, a lock that is controlled remotely and a Ring alarm system.
customer_reviews.author: RJP in NY

customer_reviews.title: Recommend: rare router that actually works
customer_reviews.text: After going thru three more expensive routers, I found this smaller one to be the only reliable and worth the money. Wifi signal range and performance is great. Impressive set of features for the price and category. May not have all functionalities that supposedly higher end devices offer, but delivers the performance and quality that anyone would expect for this type of product. You are not buying an experimental buggy prototype that pretends to work randomly working well. This router just works. Just wish it had an usb port.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: MUCH BETTER THAN EXPENSIVE GAMING ROUTERS
customer_reviews.text: SO MUCH BETTER than the $300+ netgear nighthawk router! AND for MUCH LESS. This is an amazing product, right out of the box. If anything does happen to change, I will update! As of now, I am EXTREMELY happy with this device.
customer_reviews.author: Adam R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Setup
customer_reviews.text: I was trying to set it like the AC1700 I had, which quit working. I is not a flexible to setup. I was using my own IP address on the original model. This one only uses 192.168..1.1 Minor issue. Works fine. Signal strength is good, better then other. Of course I replaced my modem too. Much faster modem, Arris Surfboard. Based on acceptable models for Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C

customer_reviews.title: 5 ghz is way fast - 2.4 ghz is pretty slow.
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. 2.4 ghz is slow. Slower than sports on my old dual band. But the 5 ghz way super fast. If you are mixed environment and you need faster 2.4 , I suggest you go with a cheaper unit that supports a mix of both in a single band variety. Can’t say that for sure, but the 2.4 ghz isn’t what it could be. My IOT devices get that! I was surprised there was no firmware update available.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Router not functioning
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased for home use due to the router from Spectrum was not functioning too well.I decided to purchase my own but in the end, the router from Spectrum worked better. It is a very expensive lesson to learn especially since the time frame to return was less than a pair of slacks .. This is a great disappointment to me especially since I purchase a lot of items from Amazon. I will definitely look around before buying from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Cole

customer_reviews.title: Great functioning network bridge
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to act as a bridge between my cable router/wireless node and my computer about 20' away across the room. It works super well, but the set up was a little complicated, buried deep in the settings and didnt seem to quite work the first time. That said, it provides great LAN connectivity for my computers, and super fast internet speeds! I would really recommend this product for anyone who doesnt want to punch holes in walls or staple CATx to their walls.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R Mark

customer_reviews.title: Want easy and awesome..buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up!!! Done in like 5mins! Have a 1900+sq ft Brick house with basement and no signal issues and fast as heck on either 2.4 or 5! I’ve never owned a TP link product and was under the impression that they weren’t a quality product. Couldn’t have been more incorrect..
customer_reviews.author: MattyMo76

customer_reviews.title: So far works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: It seems fast, setup and works flawlessly. I've only had it for a few weeks now but so far I've had zero issues. I will say I've had other brands, Netgear to name one, and over time they all tend to have little issues where they need to be reset from time to time so we'll see how this one goes but so far so good. I'm only giving Tech support 3 stars because I haven't used it yet so can't really give them 5 but 3 seems wrong as well.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Hawkwing

customer_reviews.title: It's up and running.
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased a TP-Link AC1900 and for what ever reason I wasn't able to make it work after days of trying, so after thinking about it I decided on the AC2600. And lo and behold, I was able to get it installed and working quickly which is no small feat, me being technically challenged. It seems to be doing all the things it should be doing so I'm a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Bice

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: So far this router has been fantastic. I actually recommended you can actually get into the router using an app you can change settings. I looked around for a long time on Amazon before I picked this router and I read reviews on so many different ones. This one stood out to me the most. I used to use Netgear routers and I loved them for so long and from everything I've read online as well as reviews none of the Netgear routers work very well anymore and their tech support sucks. I haven't needed to call tech support for this router yet.
customer_reviews.author: Jason g Kuust

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: OK. This router works well. Loving it. I have no intention of returning it. Setup was so easy I almost screwed it up. The only regret I have is that I didn't have an extra $100 or so and gone up a couple more levels. I had no idea until today how much routers have evolved and how fast they make (or don't) a network, wireless or wired. Do NOT skimp on your router. If your going to spend that much on all your devices than give them the thing they need to connect and go.
customer_reviews.author: michael Morin

customer_reviews.title: Worked about 10 minutes
customer_reviews.text: It worked about 10 minutes, then the 5 Ghz signal cut out and none of our devices would connect to it. 2.4 Ghz signal is good at least. That said, I can't see buying this brand again. I may try to send this one back, or maybe it goes in the garbage and I try to find a brand that works out of the box. EDIT: I talked to their support, and was advised to go into the device via the web and reset the channel or frequency or whatever to avoid signal conflicts with other devices nearby. Did that. Worked well for about a week, but today it's again dropping signal all the time. Would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: UE405

customer_reviews.title: Wireless is faster than my wired!
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation, great speed and range. Greatly improved reliability over the router it replaced. I'm sitting next to my router with both cell phone (Galaxy S9) and desktop (Dell optiplex 7xxx) and the cell phone internet speed was 151Mbps while the Dell plugged into the router was 85Mpbs. I have a fiber connection and this seems to be a good router to last for a while.
customer_reviews.author: sum dumb guy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent output
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to get a little extra range. I was able to get wifi in the garage about 100 feet away. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: S. Locke

customer_reviews.title: Great coverage
customer_reviews.text: So happy with this.. I live in an area that has sketchy Wi-Fi and this has been quite an improvement over the standard one that comes with our service. It’s in my basement but I can still get Wi-Fi everywhere on my half an acre property!!!...easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Raneangel

customer_reviews.title: Good Router.  Signal not as Strong as expected.  Serves my needs
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Works as expected. Signal not as good as I expected. Ended up buying and extender which I set up as a second network about 120-150 away. both router and extender are showing full bars. I am now able to watch videos without interruption which is why I made the change.
customer_reviews.author: JRM

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: It was so easy to set up and I'm 66 years old and not super technology inclined! It replaced my older one and it has increased my coverage area. I can use WIFI in my garage and wasn't able to do this with my old one.
customer_reviews.author: James Estep

customer_reviews.title: Grate Router
customer_reviews.text: It is grate that you can turn off 5 G and / or 2.5 G and use one or the other only. Also the connection to all my devices out does the other routers I have used. With other routers I needed an extender to use all my devices. Using this router I do not need the extender.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with Centurylink Fiber Optic, or Tp Link Tech support is incompetent.
customer_reviews.text: Tried twice to use TP-Link tech support neither one could get it to work with Centurlink Fiber Optic modem. One told me I needed a PPPOE log in. I got all the PPPOE info from Centurylink, the TP-link support person couldn't get it to work. The second TP-link tech support said PPPOE is not needed. But couldn't get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: AlkiBeach

customer_reviews.title: Works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: I installed this hoping it would work as other WiFi routers I tried had not. It has been fantastic! My range is better than I expected and my speeds are great. I highly recommend it! BTW - the reason that Tech Support only has a 3 is because I didn't have to use it. So I can't say one way or the other. But everything else was great!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. John

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2,000 square foot, 1950's plaster house. Not only do I get fantastic wifi signal with fast data transfer throughout every room of the house, I even have good coverage to the edge of my yard!
customer_reviews.author: Sissy D.

customer_reviews.title: Works but problems
customer_reviews.text: Seems to loose the wireless on/off schedule that I set for it every week or so. ( It may be loosing the current time) I have to Cold restart it inorder to login into it to and administer it. CAn't login with Firefox, but Safari works. Tech support (Chat) maybe 24/7, but they don't seem to know the product.
customer_reviews.author: jad

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Netgear that was not working.
customer_reviews.text: Had a new top of the line Netgear that worked for 2 weeks, then kept disconnecting. Then it finally wouldn't work at all. Got this one, and easy install. Worked right away. Connected to Computer, phones, Xboxes, everything right away - and with strong and fast signal. Am buying another for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Mccormick

customer_reviews.title: Great Range and Data Speeds
customer_reviews.text: This router seems to have great range compared to the Belkin router it replaced. It is fairly easy to setup and I haven't had any trouble with it. All in all it is affordable, has great range, and faster data speeds that distribute bandwidth where you need it.
customer_reviews.author: CNG

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. We've had this router for about 2 weeks and have been very happy with it. With our old router, we were having very spotty WiFi and often had to reboot it to get WiFi to everyone in our house (husband working from home, kids doing distance learning, etc). It was very frustrating. Since getting this TP-Link router, we've had no issues with all five of us being online at the same time. It was easy to set up and seems to be working great.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Zero stars. Will be returning. On day two the router just stopped working. Nothing works. Tried rebooting multiple times. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: KSween

customer_reviews.title: Just Works!
customer_reviews.text: You know, I've been a Linksys customer for years, and recently had a bad experience with a product and their support. I decided to give this one a try. What I like about the TP Link product is that it just works. Solid, easy, and stable. I don't know if it will continue this way, but hoping it does - if so I will go all in on TP link.
customer_reviews.author: JLM

customer_reviews.title: Probably would've been OK if not for Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Refused to connect to my Comcast modem. Ordered a different router and had the same problem. I had to call Comcast to 'send a signal' (WTF does that mean?). Not 100% sure this would've worked in my scenario anyway. It wasn't clear that I'd be able to specify my own Pi-hole DNS in the administrative UI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Speed and Range at a good price.
customer_reviews.text: Getting 110+ Mbps which is much faster than what I was used to with my older router. The range is also excellent for our needs. We live in a relatively small apartment but the signal is strong everywhere. Now there are two adults working from home this was an excellent upgrade for us. I also appreciate the two band options 2.4 and 5ghz.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I do not know anything about tech things. We bought this on the recommendation of someone who knows a lot, installed it easily -- and life has been better, WiFi Router-wise, ever since. That's all I can tell you -- It does exactly what it's supposed to and we're very glad to have it!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy NiceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: once going it was great
customer_reviews.text: Had to work with it for a bit. I could not get internet to the router. I had to use the steps for troubleshooting on the book which helped alot. Finally got it up. I could not get an ip address but the steps to troubleshoot helped. I would say they have a video to help install to . It most defiantly helped with my iptv service. I was told not to use the ip equipment and got my own modem and router and works a ton better!. have no buffering now
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router for my client whom has all her connections for tv and Wi-Fi rigged up so well, she gets prime Wi-Fi paying only 10 bucks a month, and receives about 50 free channels... Granted she's the only one using the service, she says this router has been great and has done everything it's supposed to do. She rated it 4 stars (Minus one star for the price; she's on an adjusted income).
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Strong service
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have with this router is the sort of weak 5g but I believe it is due to the amount of walls I have to go through. All though, the 2.4 is quite strong with gig internet giving me about 300 mbs through a decent distance
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great in our condo
customer_reviews.text: It works great in our condo. We have cable internet and no signal issues upstairs or down stairs. I got this higher bandwidth version in case we need to up our speed from our provider and to prevent it from going out of date. We have been streaming music, movies, and doing zoom meeting simultaneously without issue. It is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Faunus

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I have spectrum Streaming using a Roku device. with my wireless 1750 TP Link Router I was always having Buffering problems . Once I went to the AC2600 all the problems disappeared
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sink

customer_reviews.title: Multiple users without buffering
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coverage with the matching WiFi extender. 3000 sqft house with no dead spots. Also have 4 college kids living here and with the current pandemic which has them all doing on line classes they have had no delay. We have had 4 laptops and 2 TVs all streaming without buffering. Outstanding performance!
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Peugh

customer_reviews.title: Router signal is unstable.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this router for 2 months, and for the past 4 weeks, the signal of the 5G and 2.4G goes off and on so that our computers and iPhones can't lock onto the signal. The signal is unstable. I have to reset and restart the router and then the devices can lock onto the signal. TPLink says that the problem is environmental, but that is not correct in my situation. Very frustrating! I'm going to return this model.
customer_reviews.author: RK Martin

customer_reviews.title: Does it all.
customer_reviews.text: Great speed on the input side, great throughput, great speed on wireless, great coverage. I found that my prior wireless router was limiting my overall speed to 50 mbps. The connection at the cable modem delivers 240 mbps and the Archer A10 handles it all.
customer_reviews.author: Longtime Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great range and strength
customer_reviews.text: I got this initially because of the range of the antennas which is great but as I’m using it the speeds are about double as what I was getting with my other router. I’m paying for 100 mbs through my isp. 2g gives me 60 download and 5g gives 110 which is over what I pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Chanelle Strawn

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Install was insanely. 3 minutes total and I’m no computer whiz. The speeds were pretty slow at first but the manufacturers support was available via chat at 11pm for me. I’ve used it for a couple months now and the speed is great but I got for the extra distance throughout my home. It works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. The router was easy to set up and get everything connected to. Haven't had any issues with it at all in the relatively short time I have had it. I haven't had a chance yet to run any tests to see if range and throughput are improved, but I would imagine that they are.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: If you know how to set up and secure a router, then you'll find this one very nice and easy to use. The most difficult part was mounting it to the wall! The unit has been working perfectly for about two months now.
customer_reviews.author: APF

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, didn't play well with iOS devices
customer_reviews.text: Kept dropping iOS devices off of the network, saying that the WiFi password was incorrect (it wasn't). Firmware was up to date. The only fix was to restart the router, which allowed the same devices to connect for a while until it decided to kick them off again. Docs weren't really that helpful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handles many devices like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: It works great! We have 3 smart TVs, 5+ consoles, a ton of phones and tablets and it handles it all without issues. I'm even able to stream games with it! I definitely recommend this for anyone that wants solid internet without having to fork over a fortune.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Rubalcava

customer_reviews.title: AC2600 is ideal for home use: powerful and simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy setup and improved performance compared to my old router. Easy to manage network with the Tether app, from basic setup to advanced options.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Adams

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, works well and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This replaced an earlier TP-Link router. It increased my coverage by 25 percent over the previous model. Extremely easy to set up and easy to use the interface to make it the way you want it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't pay Comcast, save money and get better signal!
customer_reviews.text: Got sick and tired of paying Comcast a monthly fee for outdated wifi router. Decided to spend some money up front to save money in the future and get much better wifi signal. Wifi signal/speed increased a lot. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas - PDX

customer_reviews.title: Nice router
customer_reviews.text: I actually returned this router after testing it. It provided good coverage; it just didn't outperform my old Cox router like I thought it would. So it didn't make sense to keep it with minimal improvement over the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Vic

customer_reviews.title: Stellar Router
customer_reviews.text: I was having spotty wifi signal so my techie son recommended I buy this router. A world of difference! The wifi signal is strong and solid.Highly recommend. Love the sleek look as well.
customer_reviews.author: Karen R

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: The router works great, good speed attainment and full household coverage. The reason I did not give a 5-star rating is that this is not fully compatible with Verizon FIOS. I thought I could completely replace my Verizon router with this but I cannot do that. The TP-Link is now hard wired to the Verizon router which is not the most desirable scenario.
customer_reviews.author: NewarkJoe

customer_reviews.title: Alert
customer_reviews.text: Perfect coverage for my 2200 sqft home. I get great reliable signal everywhere I need it.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Young

customer_reviews.title: Strong WIFI router, Work Great
customer_reviews.text: I used to have TP-Link AC1750, but the signal not strong enough to cover my new house. So, I need to buy this TP-Link AC2600 Smart WiFi Router. Stronger Signal to cover whole my house and my front and back yard with high speed (100 mbps) signal. TP-Link also has a really good system for me to manage my 2.4 and 5.0 users list, I can block any stranger device anytime that i want.
customer_reviews.author: Bluewingsdragon

customer_reviews.title: TP Link - No. Netgear Yes
customer_reviews.text: Router would not stay connected. I have a very strong signal. Tech support was difficult to reach and di not resolve the issue. Router was returned for a refund. The Netgear Nighthawk it was replaced with has been flawless.
customer_reviews.author: T. Magnus

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: What a difference having this upstairs. Like having another internet connection. Signal goes from one end to the other end of the house even outside in back yard
customer_reviews.author: MQL

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Unreliable garbage after 3 months of home use. Now we experience dropped WiFi connections all day long. Power cycling the router seems to help for an hour or so.
customer_reviews.author: Rob R

customer_reviews.title: It's a no-brainer click bye now!!
customer_reviews.text: Netgear has gone to s*** been a Netgear user for the past 10 years and was satisfied with the ease of use now that I find they don't work so I had to try something else this tp-link hooked up easy plug-in play you might say so yes I like it signals good that's all I need
customer_reviews.author: Mike boulanger

customer_reviews.title: Low out of pocket for a quality router!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup and love the 5G, works great. Still need to get into the parental control.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Milbradt

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product. Poor quality and worst user interface. The wifi started to drop every couple of days. Initially I thought it was because I was using beamforming feature. So I disabled it and created two separate ssids for 2.4 and 5g, but still it continues to drop wifi signal for no apparent reason. I don’t have any features enabled. Deeply disappointed, especially as I am past the 30 day return window.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon LongTime

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My old WiFi router was getting old and this was really easy to set up and works well. I have a small space so I don’t know how well it’ll work in a larger space.
customer_reviews.author: Keemia

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, good range, easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, good iPhone app, good integration with my TP-Link range extender. With my previous router I could not get good signal to my Ring doorbell or garage security cam, but now both can connect to WiFi without issue. Price as great too.
customer_reviews.author: Greenspace

customer_reviews.title: great unit
customer_reviews.text: We used this as the main router on a sim router[host] system,works great with more range than an old one my son in law had laying around,easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: robert m rehrig

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: I missed that it was 192.168.0.1 Old TP-Link router was 192.168.1.1 Caused some minor setup issues, but was my fault for not correcting.
customer_reviews.author: Harold P. Fultz, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: I must have received a dud because the wifi range was terrible and it dropped continuously. I ended up buying a Motorola at the mart of walton and there is no comparison!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Allegri

customer_reviews.title: Zoom doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a good router. My parents got one for camp and their WiFi signal sucks but at least they have WiFi!! If you’re looking for a cheap fix, this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca F.

customer_reviews.title: Much better signal than ATT 2Wire
customer_reviews.text: I’m using this behind the two-in-one router/modem ATT provided. It improved the signal and multiple connectivity throughout the house by a large margin.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection, requires restart often
customer_reviews.text: After a week or so this router will let you connect (the signal is strong) then it immediately drops the connection. Restarting the device resolves the problem, but I don't want to restart the device on a weekly basis.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Leipzig

customer_reviews.title: Faster - Stonger - Built to work Safer and Faster at Home
customer_reviews.text: Improved our signal strength tremendously. Covers a 2400 sq/ft ranch home plus basement and patio extremely well. Improved speeds too.
customer_reviews.author: Edward C. Furey, Jr.

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC2600 Smart WiFi Router - MU-MIMO, Gigabit Wireless Router, Full Gigabit Ethernet Ports, Beamforming, Long Range Coverage, VPN Server, Works with Alexa(Archer A10)
product_meta.description: Model:AC2600, WiFi 5 Router*Maximum wireless transmission rates are the physical rates derived from IEEE standard 802.11 Specifications. Range and coverage specifications along with the number of connected devices were defined according to test results under normal usage conditions. Actual wireless transmission rate, wireless coverage, and number of connected devices are not guaranteed, and will vary as a result of 1) environmental factors, including building materials, physical objects and obstacles, 2) network conditions, including local interference, volume and density of traffic, product location, network complexity, and network overhead and 3) client limitations, including rated performance, location, connection quality, and client condition.
feature_bullets: JD Power Award: Highest in customer satisfaction for wireless routers 2017 and 2019
Extreme Dual band Wi-Fi speeds: 1733 Mbps on 5 GHz, 800 Mbps on 2.4 GHz, high speed Wireless Internet Router
Ultimate range:  3 external antennas and 1 internal antenna for wireless networks amplified, Beamforming for signal focused to connected devices
Higher overall throughput: MU-MIMO + Smart Connect + Airtime Fairness for maximum throughput
Secure remote access: open & PPTP VPN Server for secure remote access to your home network via the Internet
Easy Setup: Intuitive Phone UI and Tether app for quick network setup within minutes
Works with Amazon Alexa, turn on/off guest WiFi with simple voice commands, ideal WiFi Router for home
Industry leading 2 year Warranty and 24/7 technical Support

specifications.Wireless Type: 5 GHz Radio Frequency, 2.4 GHz Radio Frequency
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,046 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
